name: usage-policy
title: Usage Policy
description: Information about rights, usage, and attribution statements applicable to an entity.
comments: This is a convenience class to group related properties.
rdfs:comment: Rights and attribution statements applicable to an entity.

fields.name: usagePolicyID
fields.title: Usage Policy ID
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: rights
fields.title: Rights
fields.description: Information about rights held in and over the resource. A full-text, readable copyright statement, as required by the national legislation of the copyright holder. On collections, this applies to all contained objects, unless the object itself has a different statement. Examples: “Copyright XY 2008, all rights reserved”, “© 2008 XY Museum” , `Public Domain.`; `Copyright unknown.` Do not place just the name of the copyright holder(s) here! That belongs in a list in the xmpRights:Owner field, which should be supplied if dc:rights is not 'Public Domain', which is appropriate only if the resource is known to be not under copyright. See also the entry for dcterms:rights in this document and see the DCMI FAQ on DC and DCTERMS Namespaces for discussion of the rationale for terms in two namespaces. Normal practice is to use the same Label if both are provided. Labels have no effect on information discovery and are only suggestions.
fields.examples: `Copyright 2014 Ron Thomas` or a URI like `http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode`
fields.rdfs:comment: Information about rights held in and over the resource. A full-text, readable copyright statement, as required by the national legislation of the copyright holder. On collections, this applies to all contained objects, unless the object itself has a different statement. Examples: “Copyright XY 2008, all rights reserved”, “© 2008 XY Museum” , `Public Domain.`; `Copyright unknown.` Do not place just the name of the copyright holder(s) here! That belongs in a list in the xmpRights:Owner field, which should be supplied if dc:rights is not 'Public Domain', which is appropriate only if the resource is known to be not under copyright. See also the entry for dcterms:rights in this document and see the DCMI FAQ on DC and DCTERMS Namespaces for discussion of the rationale for terms in two namespaces. Normal practice is to use the same Label if both are provided. Labels have no effect on information discovery and are only suggestions.

fields.name: rightsIRI
fields.title: Rights IRI
fields.description: A URI pointing to structured information about rights held in and over the resource. Examples include http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode and http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. At least one of dcterms:rights and dc:rights must be supplied but, when feasible, supplying both may make the metadata more widely useful. They must specify the same rights. In case of ambiguity, dcterms:rights prevails.
fields.rdfs:comment: A URI pointing to structured information about rights held in and over the resource. Examples include http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode and http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. At least one of dcterms:rights and dc:rights must be supplied but, when feasible, supplying both may make the metadata more widely useful. They must specify the same rights. In case of ambiguity, dcterms:rights prevails.

fields.name: rightsHolder
fields.title: Rights Holder
fields.description: A name of a dcterms:Agent that owns or manages rights over a resource.
fields.rdfs:comment: A person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource.

fields.name: rightsHolderID
fields.title: Rights Holder ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dcterms:Agent that owns or manages rights over a resource.
fields.rdfs:comment: A person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource.

fields.name: owner
fields.title: Owner
fields.description: A name of a dcterms:Agent that owns the copyright for a resource.
fields.examples: `The names of the owners `Ron Thomas, Roz Thomas` or a URI that identifies the owner`
fields.rdfs:comment: A list of the names of the owners of the copyright. 'Unknown' is an acceptable value, but 'Public Domain' is not.

fields.name: ownerID
fields.title: Owner ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dcterms:Agent that owns the copyright for a resource.
fields.rdfs:comment: A list of the names of the owners of the copyright. 'Unknown' is an acceptable value, but 'Public Domain' is not.

fields.name: usageTerms
fields.title: Usage Terms
fields.description: A license statement defining how resources may be used. Information on a collection applies to all contained objects unless an object has a different statement.
fields.rdfs:comment: The license statement defining how resources may be used. Information on a collection applies to all contained objects unless the object has a different statement.

fields.name: webStatement
fields.title: Web Statement
fields.description: A URL defining or further elaborating on a license statement (e.g., a web page explaining the precise terms of use).
fields.rdfs:comment: A URL defining or further elaborating on the license statement (e. g., a web page explaining the precise terms of use).

fields.name: accessRights
fields.title: Access Rights
fields.description: Information about who can access the resource or an indication of its security status.
fields.comments: Access Rights may include information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies.
fields.rdfs:comment: Information about who access the resource or an indication of its security status.

fields.name: license
fields.title: License
fields.description: A legal document giving official permission to do something with a resource.
fields.comments: Recommended practice is to identify the license document with a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a literal value that identifies the license may be provided.
fields.rdfs:comment: A legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource.

fields.name: licenseLogoURL
fields.title: License Logo URL
fields.description: A URL providing access to a logo that symbolizes a dcterms:license.
fields.comments: The originating metadata provider is strongly urged to choose a suitable logo as a graphical representation of the license. Failure to do so may leave downstream aggregators in a difficult position to supply a logo that adequately represents the professional, legal, or social aims of the licensors (license givers). Example: http://i.creativecommons.org/l/by-nc-sa/3.0/us/88x31.png provides access to a logo image.
fields.rdfs:comment: A URL providing access to a logo that symbolizes the License.

fields.name: licensingException
fields.title: Licensing Exception
fields.description: The licensing statement for this variant of the dwc:Media resource if different from that given in the dcterms:license property of the resource.
fields.comments: Required only if this version has different licensing than that of a corresponding dwc:Media resource. For example, the highest resolution version may be more restricted than lower resolution versions.
fields.rdfs:comment: The licensing statement for this variant of the media resource if different from that given in the License Statement property of the resource.

fields.name: credit
fields.title: Credit
fields.description: Free text describing how credit should be attributed.
fields.rdfs:comment: Free text for `Please cite this as…`

fields.name: attributionLogoURL
fields.title: Attribution Logo URL
fields.description: The URL of the icon or logo image to appear in source attribution.
fields.rdfs:comment: The URL of the icon or logo image to appear in source attribution.

fields.name: attributionLinkURL
fields.title: Attribution Link URL
fields.description: The URL where information about ownership, attribution, etc. of the resource may be found.
fields.rdfs:comment: The URL where information about ownership, attribution, etc. of the resource may be found.
